query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Ma poi che ’l gratular si fu assolto, 26 tacito coram me ciascun s’affisse, 27 ignito sì che vincëa ’l mio volto.
query.result:
**English:**
25 But after the weeping was finished, 26 each one stood silently before me, 27 glowing so that they conquered my face.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Api ca yadā rudanam samāptam abhavat, 26 tataḥ praśāntāḥ punaḥ punaḥ mama agre sthitāḥ, 27 prakāśamānāḥ evamrūpeṇa yathā mama mukhamabhibhavanti sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Ridendo allora Bëatrice disse: 29 «Inclita vita per cui la larghezza 30 de la nostra basilica si scrisse,
31 fa risonar la spene in questa altezza: 32 tu sai, che tante fiate la figuri, 33 quante Iesù ai tre fé più carezza».
query.result:
**English:**
28 Then Beatrice, smiling, said: 29 "Illustrious soul, for whom the breadth 30 of our basilica was inscribed,
31 make hope resound at this height: 32 you know that as many times as Jesus 33 showed greater affection to the three,
**Sanskrit:**
28 Tadā hasantī Bēatrīcē uvāca: 29 "Viśiṣṭaḥ jīvaḥ yēna viśālatā 30 asmākam basilikāsya likhitā āsīt,
31 āśāṃ prakaṭaya asmimsthāne: 32 tvam jānāsi, yāvatīn varān Iēsus 33 tribhyaḥ adhikaṃ prītiṃ cakāra."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 «Leva la testa e fa che t’assicuri: 35 che ciò che vien qua sù del mortal mondo, 36 convien ch’ai nostri raggi si maturi».
query.result:
**English:**
34 "Lift up your head and be assured, 35 for what comes up here from the mortal world 36 must ripen in our rays."
**Sanskrit:**
34 Śirasaṃ nāma gṛhītvā niścayam kuru: 35 yat kiṃcid iha martyalokāt āgacchati, 36 tad asmākaṃ raśmibhiḥ paripākaṃ yāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Questo conforto del foco secondo 38 mi venne; ond’ io leväi li occhi a’ monti 39 che li ’ncurvaron pria col troppo pondo.
query.result:
**English:**
37 This comfort of the second fire 38 came to me; whereupon I raised my eyes to the mountains 39 which had bowed them down before with their excessive burden.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Ayam agneḥ dvitīyaḥ samutthānaḥ 38 Mama āgataḥ; yataḥ aham udvāhitaḥ akṣīṇi parvataiḥ 39 Ye pūrvam atibhāreṇa mama prṣṭhaṃ ananāmun.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 «Poi che per grazia vuol che tu t’affronti 41 lo nostro Imperadore, anzi la morte, 42 ne l’aula più secreta co’ suoi conti,
43 sì che, veduto il ver di questa corte, 44 la spene, che là giù bene innamora, 45 in te e in altrui di ciò conforte,
46 di’ quel ch’ell’ è, di’ come se ne ’nfiora 47 la mente tua, e dì onde a te venne».
query.result:
**English:**
40 "Since by grace it is willed that you confront 41 our Emperor, or rather, Death, 42 in the most secret chamber with his counts,
43 so that, having seen the truth of this court, 44 the hope that down there rightly enchants, 45 may comfort you and others in this,
46 tell what it is, tell how your mind is adorned 47 with it, and tell where it came to you."
**Sanskrit:**
40 "Yataḥ anugraheṇa icchati yadi tvam abhimukho bhavaḥ 41 asmākam Iśvaram, api tu mṛtyum, 42 antaḥpura-madhye sva-parishad-sahitaḥ,
43 yathā, dṛṣṭvā satyam asya sabhāyāḥ, 44 āśā, yā adhastāt priyam eva mohayati, 45 tvatraiva anyeṣu ca asmin viṣaye prīti-janani bhavati,
46 bruhi sā kim asti, bruhi katham tayā tava manaḥ puṣpitam, 47 bru ca kutaḥ sā tvayi āgatā."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
48 Così seguì ’l secondo lume ancora.
49 E quella pïa che guidò le penne 50 de le mie ali a così alto volo, 51 a la risposta così mi prevenne:
52 «La Chiesa militante alcun figliuolo 53 non ha con più speranza, com’ è scritto 54 nel Sol che raggia tutto nostro stuolo:
55 però li è conceduto che d’Egitto 56 vegna in Ierusalemme per vedere, 57 anzi che ’l militar li sia prescritto.
query.result:
**English:**
48 Thus I followed the second light again.
49 And that pious one who guided the feathers 50 of my wings to such a high flight, 51 anticipated me in the response thus:
52 "The Church Militant has no son 53 with greater hope, as it is written 54 in the Sun that radiates over all our host:
55 therefore it is granted to him that from Egypt 56 he may come to Jerusalem to see, 57 before his warfare is prescribed for him.
**Sanskrit:**
48 Evam aham dvitīyam api prakāśam anugataḥ.
49 Tathā ca sā dayāluḥ yā mama pakṣayoḥ patrakāṇi ittham ucchaistarataḥ patanāya niyojayām āsa,
50 mama uttaram evam pūrvam eva dadau:
51 "Yuddhāya samarpitāyāḥ sabhāyāḥ ekaḥ api putraḥ na asti,
52 yasya ātmani adhika āśā syāt, yathā likhitam asti
53 tasmin sūrye yeṣām raśmibhiḥ asmākam samastaḥ samūhaḥ prakāśate:
54 tasmāt tasmai anujñātaḥ asti yathā sa Miśrāt
55 Yeruśaleme draṣṭum āgacchet,
56 pūrvam eva yāvat tasya yuddha-karma niścityate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Li altri due punti, che non per sapere 59 son dimandati, ma perch’ ei rapporti 60 quanto questa virtù t’è in piacere,
61 a lui lasc’ io, ché non li saran forti 62 né di iattanza; ed elli a ciò risponda, 63 e la grazia di Dio ciò li comporti».
query.result:
**English:**
58 The other two points, which are not asked 59 for knowledge, but so that he may relate 60 how much this virtue pleases you,
61 I leave to him, for they will not be difficult for him 62 nor presumptuous; and let him answer this, 63 and may the grace of God grant him this.
**Sanskrit:**
58 Apare dve padye, ye na jñānārtham, 59 Api tu tenaivam vaktavyam, 60 Yāvatī te ayam guṇaḥ priyā,
61 Tam aham tasmai muñcāmi, na ca tasya kaṣṭe bhaveyuḥ, 62 Na ca abhimāne; sa ca etat pratyuttaram dadātu, 63 Iśvarasya ca anugrahaḥ etad asmai samarpatu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Come discente ch’a dottor seconda 65 pronto e libente in quel ch’elli è esperto, 66 perché la sua bontà si disasconda,
67 «Spene», diss’ io, «è uno attender certo 68 de la gloria futura, il qual produce 69 grazia divina e precedente merto.
query.result:
**English:**
64 As a learner who, in the presence of a teacher, 65 is quick and eager in that in which he is skilled, 66 so that his goodness may be revealed,
67 "Hope," I said, "is a certain expectation 68 of future glory, which produces 69 divine grace and preceding merit.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Yathā śiṣyaḥ ācāryasya samīpe 65 tatra yaḥ kuśalaḥ sa tatra śīghraḥ prasannaca bhavati, 66 yena tasya śubhatā prakāśyate,
67 "Āśā" iti ahaṃ avocat, "asti niścitā pratyākṣā 68 bhaviṣyatī śrīḥ, yā janayati 69 daivīṃ kṛpāṃ pūrvam ca puṇyam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Da molte stelle mi vien questa luce; 71 ma quei la distillò nel mio cor pria 72 che fu sommo cantor del sommo duce.
query.result:
**English:**
70 From many stars this light comes to me; 71 but he distilled it in my heart before, 72 who was the supreme singer of the supreme leader.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Anekebhyaḥ nakṣatrebhyaḥ ayam prakāśaḥ mama āgacchati; 71 Api tu saḥ mama hṛdaye pūrva eva tam asāvayat, 72 Yaḥ parama netā parama gāyakaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 ‘Sperino in te’, ne la sua tëodia 74 dice, ‘color che sanno il nome tuo’: 75 e chi nol sa, s’elli ha la fede mia?
76 Tu mi stillasti, con lo stillar suo, 77 ne la pistola poi; sì ch’io son pieno, 78 e in altrui vostra pioggia repluo».
query.result:
**English:**
73 "I hope in you," in his theology 74 he says, "those who know your name": 75 and who does not know it, if he has my faith?
76 You instilled in me, with his instilling, 77 in the Epistle then; so that I am full, 78 and in others I pour back your rain."
**Sanskrit:**
73 Tavaiva nāma veda ye janāḥ, 74 ते 'pi tvayi āśām kurvanti, 75 yaś ca na veda, sa api mama viśvāsam ālambya tvayi āśām kurute.
76 Tatraiva tava prasādena pūrṇo 'ham abhūvam, 77 yathā 'sau tava prasādena pūrṇaḥ abhavat, 78 tataś ca tava prasādam anyeṣām api prāpayāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Mentr’ io diceva, dentro al vivo seno 80 di quello incendio tremolava un lampo 81 sùbito e spesso a guisa di baleno.
query.result:
**English:**
79 While I was speaking, within the living core 80 of that fire, a flash of lightning 81 trembled suddenly and often, like a thunderbolt.
**Sanskrit:**
79 Yāvad aham avocatam, tasya jīvasya hṛdayasya madhye 80 tasya agneḥ śikhā kācid adṛśyata 81 aśanaiḥ aśanaiḥ vidyut iva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Indi spirò: «L’amore ond’ ïo avvampo 83 ancor ver’ la virtù che mi seguette 84 infin la palma e a l’uscir del campo,
85 vuol ch’io respiri a te che ti dilette 86 di lei; ed emmi a grato che tu diche 87 quello che la speranza ti ’mpromette».
query.result:
**English:**
82 Then he breathed: "The love with which I burn 83 still toward the virtue that follows me 84 even to the palm and to the exit from the field,
85 wants me to breathe to you who delight 86 in her; and it is pleasing to me that you say 87 what hope promises you."
**Sanskrit:**
82 Tataḥ sa prāṇavān: "Snehena yena dahati mama hṛdayam 83 Adyāpi prati śubhām vṛttim yā anveti mām 84 Antaṃ patram api prāpya kṣetra-tyāgam api ca,
85 Icchaiṣa mama yathā tvayi śvāsaḥ praveśayet 86 Yaḥ asyāḥ śubhāyāḥ vṛtteḥ parāyaṇo 'si, 87 Tathā ca mama priyam yad uktam tvayā 88 Yathā tvām āśā pratiśrutā."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 E io: «Le nove e le scritture antiche 89 pongon lo segno, ed esso lo mi addita, 90 de l’anime che Dio s’ha fatte amiche.
query.result:
**English:**
88 And I: "The new and the old writings 89 set the sign, and it points out to me 90 the souls that God has made his friends."
**Sanskrit:**
88 Aham ca: "Navāḥ ca śāstrāṇi ca pūrāṇāni ca 89 Nimittam ācakṣate, tat ca māṃ darśayati, 90 Yeṣām ātmānāṃ Devaḥ sakhāḥ kṛtāḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 E prima, appresso al fin d’este parole, 98 ‘Sperent in te’ di sopr’ a noi s’udì; 99 a che rispuoser tutte le carole.
query.result:
**English:**
97 And first, near the end of these words, 98 "Sperent in te" was heard above us; 99 to which all the circles responded.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Evaṃ ca, eṣām vacanām anta-samaye prathamam, 98 "Sperent in te" iti asmābhiḥ ūrdhvam śrutam; 99 yatra sarvāṇi maṇḍalāni pratyuttaram adaduḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Poscia tra esse un lume si schiarì 101 sì che, se ’l Cancro avesse un tal cristallo, 102 l’inverno avrebbe un mese d’un sol dì.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Then among them a light became clear, 101 so that, if Cancer had such a crystal, 102 winter would have a month of only one day.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Tataḥ teṣāṃ madhye ekaṃ jyotir abhāsat 101 Yathā, yadi Karkaṭake etadṛśaḥ sphaṭikaḥ syāt, 102 hemanta-ṛtau ekaikasya divasasya ekaḥ māsaḥ syāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 E come surge e va ed entra in ballo 104 vergine lieta, sol per fare onore 105 a la novizia, non per alcun fallo,
106 così vid’ io lo schiarato splendore 107 venire a’ due che si volgieno a nota 108 qual conveniesi al loro ardente amore.
query.result:
**English:**
103 And as a virgin rises and goes and enters the dance, 104 joyful, only to do honor 105 to the new bride, not for any fault,
106 so I saw the radiant splendor 107 come to the two who were turning to each other 108 as befits their ardent love.
**Sanskrit:**
103 Yathā ca kācit kumārī uttiṣṭhati gacchati ca praviśati nṛtyam, 104 hṛṣṭā, kevalam arthe pūjanīyāyāḥ, na kevalam kāraṇāt kaścit doṣāt,
106 Tathā aham adarśam prakāśamānaṃ tejah, 107 āgacchantam ubhayataḥ, ye parivartante parasparam abhimukham, 108 yathā ucitam asti tayoh abhinīveśātmakaṃ prema.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Misesi lì nel canto e ne la rota; 110 e la mia donna in lor tenea l’aspetto, 111 pur come sposa tacita e immota.
query.result:
**English:**
109 I placed myself there in the corner and in the wheel; 110 and my lady held her gaze upon them, 111 just like a silent and motionless bride.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Aham tatra kāṇe evaṃ cakre ca sthitaḥ abhavam; 110 Mama patnī ca tatra dṛṣṭim adadhāt, 111 Yathā tu vadhūr mūkaḥ aniṣṭhā ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 «Questi è colui che giacque sopra ’l petto 113 del nostro pellicano, e questi fue 114 di su la croce al grande officio eletto».
query.result:
**English:**
112 "This is he who lay upon the breast 113 of our pelican, and this is he 114 who was chosen for the great office on the cross."
**Sanskrit:**
112 Ayaṃ saḥ yaḥ śayitaḥ āsīt urasyām 113 asmākam pakṣiṇaḥ, ayam ca āsīt 114 kṛṣe mahāniyukte varaṇaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 La donna mia così; né però piùe 116 mosser la vista sua di stare attenta 117 poscia che prima le parole sue.
query.result:
**English:**
115 My lady spoke thus; nor did she move 116 her gaze from being attentive 117 after her first words.
**Sanskrit:**
115 Evam mama strī; na tu punaḥ eva 116 calayitum śaknoti dṛṣṭim svāmāvivecanīyāyāḥ 117 tataḥ prathamam vacasām asyāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Qual è colui ch’adocchia e s’argomenta 119 di vedere eclissar lo sole un poco, 120 che, per veder, non vedente diventa;
121 tal mi fec’ ïo a quell’ ultimo foco 122 mentre che detto fu: «Perché t’abbagli 123 per veder cosa che qui non ha loco?
124 In terra è terra il mio corpo, e saragli 125 tanto con li altri, che ’l numero nostro 126 con l’etterno proposito s’agguagli.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Like one who strains his eyes and tries hard 119 to see a solar eclipse a little, 120 and, by trying to see, becomes sightless;
121 so I became at that final fire, 122 while it was said to me: "Why do you dazzle yourself 123 trying to see what has no place here?
124 My body is earth on earth, and it will be there 125 with the others, until our number 126 matches the eternal plan.
**Sanskrit:**
118 Yaḥ kaścid adhyavasāyaṃ kṛtvā prayatate 119 sūryagrahaṇamaṇḍalamalpamapi draṣṭum, 120 sa draṣṭukāmaḥ adarśanaṃ prāpnoti;
121 tathā aham api tasmin antyatama agnau abhūvam, 122 yadā mayā uktaṃ babhūva: "kimartham tvam mohayasi ātmānam 123 draṣṭukāmaḥ tat yat atra na vidyate?
124 mama śarīram pṛthivī eva pṛthivyām asti, ca 125 anyaiḥ saha tāvatkālam bhavitā, yāvat naḥ saṅkhyā 126 nityena niścayena samabhibhūyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Con le due stole nel beato chiostro 128 son le due luci sole che saliro; 129 e questo apporterai nel mondo vostro».
query.result:
**English:**
127 With the two garlands in the blessed cloister 128 are the two lights alone that ascended; 129 and this you will bring back to your world."
**Sanskrit:**
127 Dve stole saha subhe klaustre 128 Dve jyotishi ekāki ye āruhur; 129 Evaṃ ca tvam ānayasi tava jagati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 A questa voce l’infiammato giro 131 si quïetò con esso il dolce mischio 132 che si facea nel suon del trino spiro,
133 sì come, per cessar fatica o rischio, 134 li remi, pria ne l’acqua ripercossi, 135 tutti si posano al sonar d’un fischio.
query.result:
**English:**
130 At this voice the fiery circle 131 became quiet, along with the sweet mingling 132 that was made in the sound of the threefold breath,
133 just as, to cease toil or danger, 134 the oars, before striking the water again, 135 all come to rest at the sound of a whistle.
**Sanskrit:**
130 Asyām vāṇyām agnijvālaḥ pradakṣiṇo mārgaḥ 131 Samadhigamat sahitam madhuramiśreṇa 132 Yaḥ śabdaḥ sambhavati trayī śvāsa-vāyu-saṃyogāt,
133 Yathā, śrama-bhaya-nivṛttyartham, 134 Tiryag-bhāvena pūrvaṃ jale praharataḥ, 135 Ekaika-śruti-śravaṇena viśrāntim āpnuyur daṇḍāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Ahi quanto ne la mente mi commossi, 137 quando mi volsi per veder Beatrice, 138 per non poter veder, benché io fossi
139 presso di lei, e nel mondo felice!
query.result:
**English:**
136 Ah, how I was moved in my mind, 137 when I turned to see Beatrice, 138 because I could not see her, although I was
139 near her, and in the happy world!
**Sanskrit:**
136 Aha, katham aham manaḥi komalīkṛtaḥ, 137 yadā aham āvartāmi Beatricim draṣṭum, 138 na śaknomi draṣṭum, yadyapi aham āsmi
139 tasya समीपे, sukhasya loke ca!
